trans-unit.source: when the aspect ratio of the given width and height doesn't match that of the image, it will be cropped to the new ratio before resizing

seg-source.mrk: when the aspect ratio of the given width and height doesn't match that of the image, it will be cropped to the new ratio before resizing

target.mrk: when the aspect ratio of the given width and height doesn't match that of the image, it will be cropped to the new ratio before resizing

trans-unit.source: [[doku>DokuWiki]] supports some simple markup language, which tries to make the datafiles to be as readable as possible. This page contains all possible syntax you may use when editing the pages. Simply have a look at the source of this page by pressing "Edit this page". If you want to try something, just use the [[playground:playground|playground]] page. The simpler markup is easily accessible via [[doku>toolbar|quickbuttons]], too.

seg-source.mrk: [[doku>DokuWiki]] supports some simple markup language, which tries to make the datafiles to be as readable as possible.
This page contains all possible syntax you may use when editing the pages.
Simply have a look at the source of this page by pressing "Edit this page".
If you want to try something, just use the [[playground:playground|playground]] page.
The simpler markup is easily accessible via [[doku>toolbar|quickbuttons]], too.

target.mrk: [[doku>DokuWiki]] supports some simple markup language, which tries to make the datafiles to be as readable as possible.
This page contains all possible syntax you may use when editing the pages.
Simply have a look at the source of this page by pressing "Edit this page".
If you want to try something, just use the [[playground:playground|playground]] page.
The simpler markup is easily accessible via [[doku>toolbar|quickbuttons]], too.

trans-unit.source: DokuWiki supports **bold**, //italic//, __underlined__ and ''monospaced'' texts. Of course you can **__//''combine''//__** all these.

seg-source.mrk: Of course you can **__//''combine''//__** all these.

target.mrk: Of course you can **__//''combine''//__** all these.

trans-unit.source: You can mark something as <del>deleted</del> as well.

seg-source.mrk: You can mark something as <del>deleted</del> as well.

target.mrk: You can mark something as <del>deleted</del> as well.

trans-unit.source: **Paragraphs** are created from blank lines. If you want to **force a newline** without a paragraph, you can use two backslashes followed by a whitespace or the end of line.

seg-source.mrk: If you want to **force a newline** without a paragraph, you can use two backslashes followed by a whitespace or the end of line.

target.mrk: If you want to **force a newline** without a paragraph, you can use two backslashes followed by a whitespace or the end of line.

trans-unit.source: This is some text with some linebreaks\\ Note that the two backslashes are only recognized at the end of a line\\ or followed by\\ a whitespace \\this happens without it.

seg-source.mrk: This is some text with some linebreaks\\ Note that the two backslashes are only recognized at the end of a line\\ or followed by\\ a whitespace \\this happens without it.

target.mrk: This is some text with some linebreaks\\ Note that the two backslashes are only recognized at the end of a line\\ or followed by\\ a whitespace \\this happens without it.

trans-unit.source: You should use forced newlines only if really needed.

seg-source.mrk: You should use forced newlines only if really needed.

target.mrk: You should use forced newlines only if really needed.

trans-unit.source: DokuWiki supports multiple ways of creating links.

seg-source.mrk: DokuWiki supports multiple ways of creating links.

target.mrk: DokuWiki supports multiple ways of creating links.

trans-unit.source: External links are recognized automagically: http://www.google.com or simply www.google.com - You can set the link text as well: [[http://www.google.com|This Link points to google]]. Email addresses like this one: <andi@splitbrain.org> are recognized, too.

seg-source.mrk: External links are recognized automagically: http://www.google.com or simply www.google.com - You can set the link text as well: [[http://www.google.com|This Link points to google]].
Email addresses like this one: <andi@splitbrain.org> are recognized, too.

target.mrk: External links are recognized automagically: http://www.google.com or simply www.google.com - You can set the link text as well: [[http://www.google.com|This Link points to google]].
Email addresses like this one: <andi@splitbrain.org> are recognized, too.

trans-unit.source: Internal links are created by using square brackets. You can either just give a [[pagename]] or use an additional [[pagename|link text]].

seg-source.mrk: Internal links are created by using square brackets.
You can either just give a [[pagename]] or use an additional [[pagename|link text]].

target.mrk: Internal links are created by using square brackets.
You can either just give a [[pagename]] or use an additional [[pagename|link text]].

trans-unit.source: [[doku>pagename|Wiki pagenames]] are converted to lowercase automatically, special characters are not allowed.

seg-source.mrk: [[doku>pagename|Wiki pagenames]] are converted to lowercase automatically, special characters are not allowed.

target.mrk: [[doku>pagename|Wiki pagenames]] are converted to lowercase automatically, special characters are not allowed.

trans-unit.source: You can use [[some:namespaces]] by using a colon in the pagename.

seg-source.mrk: You can use [[some:namespaces]] by using a colon in the pagename.

target.mrk: You can use [[some:namespaces]] by using a colon in the pagename.

trans-unit.source: Linking to a specific section is possible, too. Just add the section name behind a hash character as known from HTML. This links to [[syntax#internal|this Section]].

seg-source.mrk: Linking to a specific section is possible, too.
Just add the section name behind a hash character as known from HTML.

target.mrk: Linking to a specific section is possible, too.
Just add the section name behind a hash character as known from HTML.

trans-unit.source: Links to [[syntax|existing pages]] are shown in a different style from [[nonexisting]] ones.

seg-source.mrk: Links to [[syntax|existing pages]] are shown in a different style from [[nonexisting]] ones.

target.mrk: Links to [[syntax|existing pages]] are shown in a different style from [[nonexisting]] ones.

trans-unit.source: DokuWiki does not use [[wp>CamelCase]] to automatically create links by default, but this behavior can be enabled in the [[doku>config]] file. Hint: If DokuWiki is a link, then it's enabled.

seg-source.mrk: DokuWiki does not use [[wp>CamelCase]] to automatically create links by default, but this behavior can be enabled in the [[doku>config]] file.
Hint: If DokuWiki is a link, then it's enabled.

target.mrk: DokuWiki does not use [[wp>CamelCase]] to automatically create links by default, but this behavior can be enabled in the [[doku>config]] file.
Hint: If DokuWiki is a link, then it's enabled.

trans-unit.source: When a section's heading is changed, its bookmark changes, too. So don't rely on section linking too much.

seg-source.mrk: When a section's heading is changed, its bookmark changes, too.
So don't rely on section linking too much.

target.mrk: When a section's heading is changed, its bookmark changes, too.
So don't rely on section linking too much.

trans-unit.source: DokuWiki supports [[doku>Interwiki]] links. These are quick links to other Wikis. For example this is a link to Wikipedia's page about Wikis: [[wp>Wiki]].

seg-source.mrk: These are quick links to other Wikis.
For example this is a link to Wikipedia's page about Wikis: [[wp>Wiki]].

target.mrk: These are quick links to other Wikis.
For example this is a link to Wikipedia's page about Wikis: [[wp>Wiki]].

trans-unit.source: Windows shares like [[\\server\share|this]] are recognized, too. Please note that these only make sense in a homogeneous user group like a corporate [[wp>Intranet]].

seg-source.mrk: Windows shares like [[\\server\share|this]] are recognized, too.
Please note that these only make sense in a homogeneous user group like a corporate [[wp>Intranet]].

target.mrk: Windows shares like [[\\server\share|this]] are recognized, too.
Please note that these only make sense in a homogeneous user group like a corporate [[wp>Intranet]].

trans-unit.source: For security reasons direct browsing of windows shares only works in Microsoft Internet Explorer per default (and only in the "local zone").

seg-source.mrk: For security reasons direct browsing of windows shares only works in Microsoft Internet Explorer per default (and only in the "local zone").

target.mrk: For security reasons direct browsing of windows shares only works in Microsoft Internet Explorer per default (and only in the "local zone").

trans-unit.source: For Mozilla and Firefox it can be enabled through different workaround mentioned in the [[http://kb.mozillazine.org/Links_to_local_pages_do_not_work|Mozilla Knowledge Base]]. However, there will still be a JavaScript warning about trying to open a Windows Share. To remove this warning (for all users), put the following line in ''conf/userscript.js'':

seg-source.mrk: For Mozilla and Firefox it can be enabled through different workaround mentioned in the [[http://kb.mozillazine.org/Links_to_local_pages_do_not_work|Mozilla Knowledge Base]].
However, there will still be a JavaScript warning about trying to open a Windows Share.
To remove this warning (for all users), put the following line in ''conf/userscript.js'':

target.mrk: For Mozilla and Firefox it can be enabled through different workaround mentioned in the [[http://kb.mozillazine.org/Links_to_local_pages_do_not_work|Mozilla Knowledge Base]].
However, there will still be a JavaScript warning about trying to open a Windows Share.
To remove this warning (for all users), put the following line in ''conf/userscript.js'':

trans-unit.source: You can also use an image to link to another internal or external page by combining the syntax for links and [[#images_and_other_files|images]] (see below) like this:

seg-source.mrk: You can also use an image to link to another internal or external page by combining the syntax for links and [[#images_and_other_files|images]] (see below) like this:

target.mrk: You can also use an image to link to another internal or external page by combining the syntax for links and [[#images_and_other_files|images]] (see below) like this:

trans-unit.source: Please note: The image formatting is the only formatting syntax accepted in link names.

seg-source.mrk: Please note: The image formatting is the only formatting syntax accepted in link names.

target.mrk: Please note: The image formatting is the only formatting syntax accepted in link names.

trans-unit.source: The whole [[#images_and_other_files|image]] and [[#links|link]] syntax is supported (including image resizing, internal and external images and URLs and interwiki links).

seg-source.mrk: The whole [[#images_and_other_files|image]] and [[#links|link]] syntax is supported (including image resizing, internal and external images and URLs and interwiki links).

target.mrk: The whole [[#images_and_other_files|image]] and [[#links|link]] syntax is supported (including image resizing, internal and external images and URLs and interwiki links).

trans-unit.source: You can add footnotes (([#$tu38])) by using double parentheses.

seg-source.mrk: You can add footnotes (([#$tu38])) by using double parentheses.

target.mrk: You can add footnotes (([#$tu38])) by using double parentheses.

trans-unit.source: You can use up to five different levels of headlines to structure your content. If you have more than three headlines, a table of contents is generated automatically -- this can be disabled by including the string ''<nowiki>~~NOTOC~~</nowiki>'' in the document.

seg-source.mrk: You can use up to five different levels of headlines to structure your content.
If you have more than three headlines, a table of contents is generated automatically -- this can be disabled by including the string ''<nowiki>~~NOTOC~~</nowiki>'' in the document.

target.mrk: You can use up to five different levels of headlines to structure your content.
If you have more than three headlines, a table of contents is generated automatically -- this can be disabled by including the string ''<nowiki>~~NOTOC~~</nowiki>'' in the document.

trans-unit.source: By using four or more dashes, you can make a horizontal line:

seg-source.mrk: By using four or more dashes, you can make a horizontal line:

target.mrk: By using four or more dashes, you can make a horizontal line:

trans-unit.source: You can include external and internal [[doku>images]] with curly brackets. Optionally you can specify the size of them.

seg-source.mrk: You can include external and internal [[doku>images]] with curly brackets.
Optionally you can specify the size of them.

target.mrk: You can include external and internal [[doku>images]] with curly brackets.
Optionally you can specify the size of them.

trans-unit.source: Resize to given width and height(([#$tu51])): {{wiki:dokuwiki-128.png?200x50}}

seg-source.mrk: Resize to given width and height(([#$tu51])): {{wiki:dokuwiki-128.png?200x50}}

target.mrk: Resize to given width and height(([#$tu51])): {{wiki:dokuwiki-128.png?200x50}}

trans-unit.source: By using left or right whitespaces you can choose the alignment.

seg-source.mrk: By using left or right whitespaces you can choose the alignment.

target.mrk: By using left or right whitespaces you can choose the alignment.

trans-unit.source: Of course, you can add a title (displayed as a tooltip by most browsers), too.

seg-source.mrk: Of course, you can add a title (displayed as a tooltip by most browsers), too.

target.mrk: Of course, you can add a title (displayed as a tooltip by most browsers), too.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a filename (external or internal) that is not an image (''gif, jpeg, png''), then it will be displayed as a link instead.

seg-source.mrk: If you specify a filename (external or internal) that is not an image (''gif, jpeg, png''), then it will be displayed as a link instead.

target.mrk: If you specify a filename (external or internal) that is not an image (''gif, jpeg, png''), then it will be displayed as a link instead.

trans-unit.source: For linking an image to another page see [[#Image Links]] above.

seg-source.mrk: For linking an image to another page see [[#Image Links]] above.

target.mrk: For linking an image to another page see [[#Image Links]] above.

trans-unit.source: Dokuwiki supports ordered and unordered lists. To create a list item, indent your text by two spaces and use a ''*'' for unordered lists or a ''-'' for ordered ones.

seg-source.mrk: Dokuwiki supports ordered and unordered lists.
To create a list item, indent your text by two spaces and use a ''*'' for unordered lists or a ''-'' for ordered ones.

target.mrk: Dokuwiki supports ordered and unordered lists.
To create a list item, indent your text by two spaces and use a ''*'' for unordered lists or a ''-'' for ordered ones.

trans-unit.source: Just use indention for deeper levels

seg-source.mrk: Just use indention for deeper levels

target.mrk: Just use indention for deeper levels

trans-unit.source: Also take a look at the [[doku>faq:lists|FAQ on list items]].

seg-source.mrk: Also take a look at the [[doku>faq:lists|FAQ on list items]].

target.mrk: Also take a look at the [[doku>faq:lists|FAQ on list items]].

trans-unit.source: DokuWiki can convert certain pre-defined characters or strings into images or other text or HTML.

seg-source.mrk: DokuWiki can convert certain pre-defined characters or strings into images or other text or HTML.

target.mrk: DokuWiki can convert certain pre-defined characters or strings into images or other text or HTML.

trans-unit.source: The text to image conversion is mainly done for smileys. And the text to HTML conversion is used for typography replacements, but can be configured to use other HTML as well.

seg-source.mrk: The text to image conversion is mainly done for smileys.
And the text to HTML conversion is used for typography replacements, but can be configured to use other HTML as well.

target.mrk: The text to image conversion is mainly done for smileys.
And the text to HTML conversion is used for typography replacements, but can be configured to use other HTML as well.

trans-unit.source: DokuWiki converts commonly used [[wp>emoticon]]s to their graphical equivalents. Those [[doku>Smileys]] and other images can be configured and extended. Here is an overview of Smileys included in DokuWiki:

seg-source.mrk: DokuWiki converts commonly used [[wp>emoticon]]s to their graphical equivalents.
Those [[doku>Smileys]] and other images can be configured and extended.
Here is an overview of Smileys included in DokuWiki:

target.mrk: DokuWiki converts commonly used [[wp>emoticon]]s to their graphical equivalents.
Those [[doku>Smileys]] and other images can be configured and extended.
Here is an overview of Smileys included in DokuWiki:

trans-unit.source: Typography: [[DokuWiki]] can convert simple text characters to their typographically correct entities. Here is an example of recognized characters.

seg-source.mrk: Typography: [[DokuWiki]] can convert simple text characters to their typographically correct entities.
Here is an example of recognized characters.

target.mrk: Typography: [[DokuWiki]] can convert simple text characters to their typographically correct entities.
Here is an example of recognized characters.

trans-unit.source: The same can be done to produce any kind of HTML, it just needs to be added to the [[doku>entities|pattern file]].

seg-source.mrk: The same can be done to produce any kind of HTML, it just needs to be added to the [[doku>entities|pattern file]].

target.mrk: The same can be done to produce any kind of HTML, it just needs to be added to the [[doku>entities|pattern file]].

trans-unit.source: There are three exceptions which do not come from that pattern file: multiplication entity (640x480), 'single' and "double quotes". They can be turned off through a [[doku>config:typography|config option]].

seg-source.mrk: There are three exceptions which do not come from that pattern file: multiplication entity (640x480), 'single' and "double quotes".
They can be turned off through a [[doku>config:typography|config option]].

target.mrk: There are three exceptions which do not come from that pattern file: multiplication entity (640x480), 'single' and "double quotes".
They can be turned off through a [[doku>config:typography|config option]].

trans-unit.source: Some times you want to mark some text to show it's a reply or comment. You can use the following syntax:

seg-source.mrk: Some times you want to mark some text to show it's a reply or comment.
You can use the following syntax:

target.mrk: Some times you want to mark some text to show it's a reply or comment.
You can use the following syntax:

trans-unit.source: I think we should do it

seg-source.mrk: I think we should do it

target.mrk: I think we should do it

trans-unit.source: DokuWiki supports a simple syntax to create tables.

seg-source.mrk: DokuWiki supports a simple syntax to create tables.

target.mrk: DokuWiki supports a simple syntax to create tables.

trans-unit.source: Table rows have to start and end with a ''|'' for normal rows or a ''^'' for headers.

seg-source.mrk: Table rows have to start and end with a ''|'' for normal rows or a ''^'' for headers.

target.mrk: Table rows have to start and end with a ''|'' for normal rows or a ''^'' for headers.

trans-unit.source: To connect cells horizontally, just make the next cell completely empty as shown above. Be sure to have always the same amount of cell separators!

seg-source.mrk: To connect cells horizontally, just make the next cell completely empty as shown above.
Be sure to have always the same amount of cell separators!

target.mrk: To connect cells horizontally, just make the next cell completely empty as shown above.
Be sure to have always the same amount of cell separators!

trans-unit.source: As you can see, it's the cell separator before a cell which decides about the formatting:

seg-source.mrk: As you can see, it's the cell separator before a cell which decides about the formatting:

target.mrk: As you can see, it's the cell separator before a cell which decides about the formatting:

trans-unit.source: You can have rowspans (vertically connected cells) by adding '':::'' into the cells below the one to which they should connect.

seg-source.mrk: You can have rowspans (vertically connected cells) by adding '':::'' into the cells below the one to which they should connect.

target.mrk: You can have rowspans (vertically connected cells) by adding '':::'' into the cells below the one to which they should connect.

trans-unit.source: Apart from the rowspan syntax those cells should not contain anything else.

seg-source.mrk: Apart from the rowspan syntax those cells should not contain anything else.

target.mrk: Apart from the rowspan syntax those cells should not contain anything else.

trans-unit.source: You can align the table contents, too. Just add at least two whitespaces at the opposite end of your text: Add two spaces on the left to align right, two spaces on the right to align left and two spaces at least at both ends for centered text.

seg-source.mrk: You can align the table contents, too.

Just add at least two whitespaces at the opposite end of your text: Add two spaces on the left to align right, two spaces on the right to align left and two spaces at least at both ends for centered text.

target.mrk: You can align the table contents, too.

Just add at least two whitespaces at the opposite end of your text: Add two spaces on the left to align right, two spaces on the right to align left and two spaces at least at both ends for centered text.

trans-unit.source: This is how it looks in the source:

seg-source.mrk: This is how it looks in the source:

target.mrk: This is how it looks in the source:

trans-unit.source: Note: Vertical alignment is not supported.

seg-source.mrk: Note: Vertical alignment is not supported.

target.mrk: Note: Vertical alignment is not supported.

trans-unit.source: If you need to display text exactly like it is typed (without any formatting), enclose the area either with ''%%<nowiki>%%'' tags or even simpler, with double percent signs ''<nowiki>%%</nowiki>''.

seg-source.mrk: If you need to display text exactly like it is typed (without any formatting), enclose the area either with ''%%<nowiki>%%'' tags or even simpler, with double percent signs ''<nowiki>%%</nowiki>''.

target.mrk: If you need to display text exactly like it is typed (without any formatting), enclose the area either with ''%%<nowiki>%%'' tags or even simpler, with double percent signs ''<nowiki>%%</nowiki>''.

trans-unit.source: <nowiki> This is some text which contains addresses like this: http://www.splitbrain.org and **formatting**, but nothing is done with it. </nowiki> The same is true for %%//__this__ text// with a smiley ;-)%%.

seg-source.mrk: <nowiki> This is some text which contains addresses like this: http://www.splitbrain.org and **formatting**, but nothing is done with it.
</nowiki> The same is true for %%//__this__ text// with a smiley ;-)%%.

target.mrk: <nowiki> This is some text which contains addresses like this: http://www.splitbrain.org and **formatting**, but nothing is done with it.
</nowiki> The same is true for %%//__this__ text// with a smiley ;-)%%.

trans-unit.source: You can include code blocks into your documents by either indenting them by at least two spaces (like used for the previous examples) or by using the tags ''%%<code>%%'' or ''%%<file>%%''.

seg-source.mrk: You can include code blocks into your documents by either indenting them by at least two spaces (like used for the previous examples) or by using the tags ''%%<code>%%'' or ''%%<file>%%''.

target.mrk: You can include code blocks into your documents by either indenting them by at least two spaces (like used for the previous examples) or by using the tags ''%%<code>%%'' or ''%%<file>%%''.

trans-unit.source: Those blocks were created by this source:

seg-source.mrk: Those blocks were created by this source:

target.mrk: Those blocks were created by this source:

trans-unit.source: [[wiki:DokuWiki]] can highlight sourcecode, which makes it easier to read. It uses the [[http://qbnz.com/highlighter/|GeSHi]] Generic Syntax Highlighter -- so any language supported by GeSHi is supported. The syntax uses the same code and file blocks described in the previous section, but this time the name of the language syntax to be highlighted is included inside the tag, e.g. ''<nowiki><code java></nowiki>'' or ''<nowiki><file java></nowiki>''.

seg-source.mrk: [[wiki:DokuWiki]] can highlight sourcecode, which makes it easier to read.
It uses the [[http://qbnz.com/highlighter/|GeSHi]] Generic Syntax Highlighter -- so any language supported by GeSHi is supported.

The syntax uses the same code and file blocks described in the previous section, but this time the name of the language syntax to be highlighted is included inside the tag, e.g. ''<nowiki><code java></nowiki>'' or ''<nowiki><file java></nowiki>''.

target.mrk: [[wiki:DokuWiki]] can highlight sourcecode, which makes it easier to read.
It uses the [[http://qbnz.com/highlighter/|GeSHi]] Generic Syntax Highlighter -- so any language supported by GeSHi is supported.

The syntax uses the same code and file blocks described in the previous section, but this time the name of the language syntax to be highlighted is included inside the tag, e.g. ''<nowiki><code java></nowiki>'' or ''<nowiki><file java></nowiki>''.

trans-unit.source: When you use the ''%%<code>%%'' or ''%%<file>%%'' syntax as above, you might want to make the shown code available for download as well. You can do this by specifying a file name after language code like this:

seg-source.mrk: When you use the ''%%<code>%%'' or ''%%<file>%%'' syntax as above, you might want to make the shown code available for download as well.
You can do this by specifying a file name after language code like this:

target.mrk: When you use the ''%%<code>%%'' or ''%%<file>%%'' syntax as above, you might want to make the shown code available for download as well.
You can do this by specifying a file name after language code like this:

trans-unit.source: If you don't want any highlighting but want a downloadable file, specify a dash (''-'') as the language code: ''%%<code - myfile.foo>%%''.

seg-source.mrk: If you don't want any highlighting but want a downloadable file, specify a dash (''-'') as the language code: ''%%<code - myfile.foo>%%''.

target.mrk: If you don't want any highlighting but want a downloadable file, specify a dash (''-'') as the language code: ''%%<code - myfile.foo>%%''.

trans-unit.source: You can embed raw HTML or PHP code into your documents by using the ''%%<html>%%'' or ''%%<php>%%'' tags. (Use uppercase tags if you need to enclose block level elements.)

seg-source.mrk: You can embed raw HTML or PHP code into your documents by using the ''%%<html>%%'' or ''%%<php>%%'' tags.
(Use uppercase tags if you need to enclose block level elements.)

target.mrk: You can embed raw HTML or PHP code into your documents by using the ''%%<html>%%'' or ''%%<php>%%'' tags.
(Use uppercase tags if you need to enclose block level elements.)

trans-unit.source: **Please Note**: HTML and PHP embedding is disabled by default in the configuration. If disabled, the code is displayed instead of executed.

seg-source.mrk: **Please Note**: HTML and PHP embedding is disabled by default in the configuration.
If disabled, the code is displayed instead of executed.

target.mrk: **Please Note**: HTML and PHP embedding is disabled by default in the configuration.
If disabled, the code is displayed instead of executed.

trans-unit.source: [[DokuWiki]] can integrate data from external XML feeds. For parsing the XML feeds, [[http://simplepie.org/|SimplePie]] is used. All formats understood by SimplePie can be used in DokuWiki as well. You can influence the rendering by multiple additional space separated parameters:

seg-source.mrk: [[DokuWiki]] can integrate data from external XML feeds.
For parsing the XML feeds, [[http://simplepie.org/|SimplePie]] is used.
All formats understood by SimplePie can be used in DokuWiki as well.
You can influence the rendering by multiple additional space separated parameters:

All formats understood by SimplePie can be used in DokuWiki as well.
You can influence the rendering by multiple additional space separated parameters:

trans-unit.source: refresh period, where d=days, h=hours, m=minutes. (e.g. 12h = 12 hours).

seg-source.mrk: refresh period, where d=days, h=hours, m=minutes.

target.mrk: refresh period, where d=days, h=hours, m=minutes.

trans-unit.source: The refresh period defaults to 4 hours. Any value below 10 minutes will be treated as 10 minutes. [[wiki:DokuWiki]] will generally try to supply a cached version of a page, obviously this is inappropriate when the page contains dynamic external content. The parameter tells [[wiki:DokuWiki]] to re-render the page if it is more than //refresh period// since the page was last rendered.

seg-source.mrk: The refresh period defaults to 4 hours.
Any value below 10 minutes will be treated as 10 minutes.
[[wiki:DokuWiki]] will generally try to supply a cached version of a page, obviously this is inappropriate when the page contains dynamic external content.
The parameter tells [[wiki:DokuWiki]] to re-render the page if it is more than //refresh period// since the page was last rendered.

target.mrk: The refresh period defaults to 4 hours.
Any value below 10 minutes will be treated as 10 minutes.
[[wiki:DokuWiki]] will generally try to supply a cached version of a page, obviously this is inappropriate when the page contains dynamic external content.
The parameter tells [[wiki:DokuWiki]] to re-render the page if it is more than //refresh period// since the page was last rendered.

trans-unit.source: DokuWiki caches all output by default. Sometimes this might not be wanted (eg. when the %%<php>%% syntax above is used), adding this macro will force DokuWiki to rerender a page on every call
